com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface changeRelease

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface changeRelease

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeRelease(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The changeRelease API takes the input XML file for an updated order release.

    • Method Detail

      • changeRelease

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeRelease(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException

        The changeRelease API takes the input XML file for an updated order release. The updated order release is examined and only changed values are applied to the order.

        For example,

          An OrderRelease is created with ShipCompleteFlag as Y with an OrderedQty value of 10. Later, the ShipCompleteFlag value gets changed to N and the ReqShipDate is also modified. The caller program does not need to know what changed; the entire order release can be passed with whatever state it is in and changeRelease determines the changes and updates both the ShipCompleteFlag and ReqShipDate, and update all relevant databases.

        The changeRelease API can also be used by supplying only the mandatory elements, and any specific values that are to be modified.

        When the changeRelease API is called, even if the order does not actually change, the NextAlert of the order is updated to the current date of the database.

        The changeRelease API can be used to create an additional line in a release, to cancel a release, or move some or all of the quantity of the release into a BACKORDER status, using the value of the Action attribute to control this processing.

        If an item is backordered through the changeRelease API, the inventory for the OrganizationCode, Node, ItemID, UnitOfMeasure, ProductClass combination will be marked as incorrect if the MARK_INV_INCORRECT_ON_BACKORDER_FROM_NODE rule of the seller's inventory organization is set to Y or PutInventoryOnHoldOnBackorder flag is passed as Y. An inventory node control entry will be created or updated with a new InvPictureIncorrectTillDate.
        If FirstAvailableDate is passed, it will be use as the InvPictureIncorrectTillDate. Otherwise, the InvPictureIncorrectTillDate is calculated by adding MARK_INV_INCORRECT_FOR_HOURS to the current date time and then rounding off the time to the next MARK_INV_INCORRECT_ROUND_OFF_TIME.

        For example,

          Current Time = 02/02/2003 15:00:00 MARK_INV_INCORRECT_FOR_HOURS = 4 hours MARK_INV_INCORRECT_ROUND_OFF_TIME = 17:00:00 The InvPictureIncorrectTillDate will be calculated to be 02/03/2003 17:00:00


        The changeRelease API will split any line that is being partially backordered from node. The portion being backordered will be split into a new line. This is controlled by the Split On Backorder of Line With Firm Predefined Node rule and Split On Backorder of Line Without Firm Predefined Node rule based upon if the IsFirmPredefinedNode flag on the order line is set to Y or N respectively. This only applies when the Use Single Node For Line Fulfillment rule is set to Y.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          Depending on modifications taking place, changeRelease may call certain user exits. Any quantity change which includes adding a line, adding quantity and cancel quantity may invoke following user exits:
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE
            This user exit is called only if element HeaderTax is not passed.
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE
            This user exit is called only if element LineTax is not passed.
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSDetermineDateForPricingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSOrderRepricingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSBeforeSplitLineUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction ORDER_RELEASE_CHANGE

          ON_SUCCESS


            Data published - YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_CHANGE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - changeRelease_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to input xml for element level details.

          ON_BACKORDER


            Data published - YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_CHANGE.ON_BACKORDER.xml
            Key data - changeRelease_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes

          ON_CANCEL:

            This event is raised when changeRelease is called to cancel quantity from any of the order lines belonging to this order release.
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_CHANGE.ON_CANCEL.xml
            Key data - changeRelease_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes

          ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:

            This event is raised for each hold type of which status has been changed.
            Data published - YFS_ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes

          ON_ORDER_LINE_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:

            This event is raised for each hold type of which status has been changed.
            Data published - YFS_ON_ORDER_LINE_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:

            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
            Data published -YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support: Yes

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published: YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions:
        The order release must already exist in the system.

        Post-conditions: N/A

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information

          Date Handling at the OrderRelease level

          Any date passed as a blank or a space ("" or " ") remains unchanged.

          If ReqShipDate or ReqDeliveryDate or both are passed, then the specified values are used to change the values. Otherwise, no change is done to these dates.
          Earliest dates are changed in accordance with the change in Requesed dates.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the modified OrderRelease. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException
